svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2023-05-03T22:25:22.785Z" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/112.0" etag="eh20xadEm8fhHdwIIdgC" version="21.2.7" type="github" pages="3"><diagram name="Arch_Draft_1" id="S_uM91Xfsd7DyZV0edvE"></diagram><diagram id="CFJHJXMNog5xB2IH2oD0" name="UML_Draft_1"></diagram><diagram id="Y6OEttpl3avurAEQQeT3" name="UML_Draft_2"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 292px; height: 240px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 195px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; width: 290px; height: 240px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; width: 100%; height: 100%; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
CyberdeckApp
- m_pProcessHandlers: unordered_map<string, unique_ptr<ProcessHandler>
- m_pConfig: shared_ptr<Config>
+ Run(): void
+ End(): void
+ Start(): void
+ SignalProcess(const string& name): bool
+ Config(): * const Config
- SignalHandler(): void
- CreateProcesses(): void
main(int argc, char** argv): void

div.div:
By starting a process, an empty .ProcessName file is made. The file is removed when ending the process. The running process on the different thread can then check whether it should be running.
When the running script ends, the thread resolves itself. IsThreadActive (with std::thread::joinable) should be used
to check the state of the thread.

switch.text: By starting a process, an empty ....
